summary.problem_solved: Normalizes various timestamp formats (Firebase Timestamp, Date objects, numeric seconds, ISO strings) into display strings or milliseconds, handling timezones consistently.

exports.name: timestamp_to_string
exports.description_one_line: Converts flexible timestamp input to formatted string.

exports.name: timestamp_to_millis
exports.description_one_line: Converts flexible timestamp input to milliseconds (number).

details.what_it_does: Detects the input type (Firebase Timestamp, Date, string, etc.), converts it to a JS Date, then uses Moment.js to format it, optionally adjusting for timezone.

minimal_correct.title: Converting Firebase timestamp to string

extensive_correct.title: Converting with custom format and timezone

incorrect_pattern.title: Common mistake: Not providing timezone for correct conversion

symbols.name: timestamp_to_millis
symbols.description_one_line: Converts flexible timestamp input to milliseconds since epoch.

details.what_it_does: Detects input type (Firebase Timestamp, Date, string, numeric seconds), converts to JavaScript Date, and returns milliseconds since epoch. Handles multiple timestamp format variations.

params.name: firebaseTimestamp
params.description: Input timestamp in any supported format

returns.description: Milliseconds since epoch, or defaultReturnedValue if invalid

minimal_correct.title: Converting Firebase timestamp to milliseconds

extensive_correct.title: Converting various formats with default fallback

incorrect_pattern.title: Common mistake: Not handling timezone for string input

symbols.name: sort_by_timestamp
symbols.description_one_line: Comparator function for sorting arrays of timestamps in ascending or descending order.

details.what_it_does: Compares two Firebase Timestamp objects by converting them to milliseconds. Returns negative (a before b), zero (equal), or positive (b before a) for use with Array.sort().

params.name: reverse
params.description: Sort descending if true, ascending if false (default: false)

returns.description: Comparison result for use in Array.sort()

minimal_correct.title: Sorting documents by timestamp ascending

extensive_correct.title: Sorting in descending order (newest first)

incorrect_pattern.title: Common mistake: Comparing timestamps directly
